caption: A tender acoustic ballad with nylon string guitar, soft cello, and gentle female vocals. The intimate production features minimal arrangement, allowing the emotional lyrics about loss and healing to take center stage.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
Empty chair at the table
Silence where laughter used to be
I still set a place for you
Out of habit out of need

[Verse 2]
Your garden still blooms in spring
The roses you planted grow
I tend them like you taught me
It's the only way I know

[Chorus]
I carry you with me
In everything I do
Though you're gone from this world
I still feel you
I carry you

[Verse 3]
Some days the grief is heavy
Some days I find my peace
I know you'd want me happy
So I'm learning to release

[Chorus]
I carry you with me
In everything I do
Though you're gone from this world
I still feel you
I carry you

[Bridge]
Love doesn't end with goodbye
It lives on it never dies

[Outro]
I carry you
